title: Floor and ceiling functions
summary: In mathematics and computer science, the floor function is the function  that takes as input a real number x, and gives as output the greatest integer less than or equal to x, denoted floor(x) or ⌊x⌋.  Similarly, the ceiling function maps x to the least integer greater than or equal to x, denoted ceil(x) or ⌈x⌉.[1]
